instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message:
This board came in dead, no power. <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> was dead so I replaced and now have PPBUS and PP3v42. There was corrosion present under the SMC, so I have done a reflow on it as well. No more 4924 donors to replace it. Here are measurements.

PPBUS - 12.58V
PP3v42 - 3.428V
PPVRTC - 3.336V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> - 12.58V
PP18vDCIN - 16.6V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.02V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.35V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.396V (Charger turns green then back to amber when I measure this)
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> - 3.412V

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message:
The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors and traces. Maybe pull SMC and reball, it seems to be running as PPBUS is 12.56V.
Check PPVRTC too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: Hey Duke. Swapped SMC and now this board will now boot/chime, PRAM, caps lock on external KB; but only with Chinese charger. Im not sure if it would have booted before swapping the SMC with a Chinese charger... I didn't think to try. Also no video at all. 0 volts going to LCD. Thanks man.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: Get a green/orange light with an original charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: Im pretty sure I do. Im not at shop now, but Im pretty sure I do. Thanks Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: Green/Orange light with original confirmed. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: SMC came from identical donor? Tried a known good LCD for 2015! model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Dead
threads.message: SMC came from 4924 donor. I have not tried another lcd yet. Wanted to figure out power issue first. Why would it power on with chinese and not original? Using 85W original charger. Maybe its my charger?
